result.execSummary:
The defendant John H Legwinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John H Legwinski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John H Legwinski was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED OF $700.00. Balance of  Fine to be paid within 30 days; alternate 1 day jail.
APPLY BAIL. ALL COSTS (DNA/DOMAB) ARE PAID IN FULL.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John H Legwinski

defendant.name: Legwinski, John H

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John H Legwinski in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 and count 2 is dismissed outright. Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $883.00
Domestic Abuse surcharge $100.00
DNA Surcharge $200.00
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply any bail. Defendant given 30 days to pay the balance or 1 day alternate.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Trial Scheduling Order filed.  Copies given to both counsel in person.

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant John H Legwinski did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 04-04-2016 02:30 pm

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant John H Legwinski did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing at 02-29-2016 09:00 am

Attorney Peter M Wolff in court.   Defendant John H Legwinski did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense does not have Discovery from the State and is requesting adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
to Appear filed by Attorney Wolff

with cover letter filed by Attorney Wolff
Hearing at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with witness/victim listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant John H Legwinski in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant allowed access to his property.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
